About UsHomeAboutContact UsContact UsThe Office of the Historian welcomes all comments and queries concerning its                        publications and will advise on research strategies for U.S. diplomatic history                        and Department of State history.Before contacting our office, please consult the Frequently Asked Questions page,                        which includes answers to many common questions.Additionally, our website has numerous resources which may answer your questions, including:Historical Documents – Foreign Relations of the United                                StatesDepartment HistoryCountriesMilestones of U.S. foreign relationsResources for teachersThe Office of the Historian can be reached via email at history@state.gov, by phone at                        202-955-0200, or by fax at 202-955-0268.AboutContact UsFrequently Asked QuestionsThe HistorianHistorical Advisory CommitteeRecent PublicationsLearn moreHomeSearchFAQTopicsHistorical DocumentsDepartment HistoryCountriesMilestones of U.S. Foreign RelationsContactAbout UsContact UsImprintPrivacy NoticeExternal Link PolicyCopyright InfoOffice of the Historian, Bureau of Public AffairsUnited States Department of Statehistory@state.govPhone: 202-955-0200Fax: 202-955-0268          var _gaq = _gaq || [];          _gaq.push(['_setAccount', 'UA-23344799-1']);          _gaq.push(['_setDomainName', 'history.state.gov']);          _gaq.push(['_trackPageview']);          (function() {{              var ga = document.createElement('script'); ga.type = 'text/javascript'; ga.async = true;              ga.src = ('https:' == document.location.protocol ?
